justification: “We administered the Boredom Proneness Scale-Short Form (Struk et al., 2017), which is a short questionnaire used to investigate trait boredom (8 items…).”

measured_by: three adjectives (bored, dull, monotonous) from the Epistemically-Related Emotion Scales
justification: “To assess the experience of boredom we used three adjectives representing pandemic boredom (i.e., bored, dull, monotonous) taken from the Epistemically-Related Emotion Scales (EES) of Pekrun et al. (2017).”

measured_by: short form of the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS-SF) – 5 positive items
justification: “We additionally included the short form of the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (Mackinnon et al. 1999), which consists of 5 positive (i.e., alert, inspired, enthusiastic, excited, determined)….”

measured_by: short form of the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS-SF) – 5 negative items
justification: “…and 5 negative items (i.e., distressed, afraid, nervous, upset, scared)” described as part of “the short form of the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule.”

measured_by: four self-report items on regional permission to travel/gather
justification: “Then the subjective perception of restrictions was assessed with four items (i.e., ‘Do the current regional COVID-19 restrictions permit that you travel…’).”
